001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.peergroup;
002
003import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.ChainTip;
004import io.reactivex.rxjava3.processors.PublishProcessor;
005import org.bitcoinj.core.Block;
006import org.bitcoinj.core.Peer;
007import org.bitcoinj.core.PeerGroup;
008import org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash;
009import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
010import org.bitcoinj.core.listeners.BlocksDownloadedEventListener;
011import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainService;
012import org.reactivestreams.Publisher;
013import org.slf4j.Logger;
014import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
015
016import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
017import java.util.concurrent.Executors;
018import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService;
019import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture;
020import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
021
022/**
023 * Provide Reactive Publishers for {@link PeerGroup} information.
024 * This implementation works with a PeerGroup w/o a Blockchain/BlockStore.
025 */
026public class RxPeerGroup implements RxBlockchainService {
027    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(RxPeerGroup.class);
028    private final PeerGroup peerGroup;
029    private static final int initialDelay = 0;
030    private static final int period = 1;
031    
032    private ScheduledExecutorService stpe;
033    // Will never return normally, and will throw an exception upon task
034    // cancellation or abnormal termination of a task execution. Use for cancelling
035    // the ScheduledExecutorService
036    private ScheduledFuture<?> scheduledFuture;
037
038    private int lastHeight = -1;
039    private final PublishProcessor<Transaction> transactionProcessor;
040    private final PublishProcessor<Integer> blockHeightProcessor;
041
042    public RxPeerGroup(PeerGroup peerGroup) {
043        this.peerGroup = peerGroup;
044        this.transactionProcessor = PublishProcessor.create();
045        this.blockHeightProcessor = PublishProcessor.create();
046        //start();   // TODO: See start()
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * TODO: Fix this. RxPeerGroup implements BlockchainService which does not have a {@code start()} method.
051     * But if we move (@code start()} to the constructor, it breaks PeerWatcher.
052     */
053    public void start() {
054        CompletableFuture<?> groupStartedFuture = peerGroup.startAsync();
055
056        // This should be a BehaviorSubject or something that caches the last message
057        blockHeightProcessor.onNext(peerGroup.getMostCommonChainHeight());
058
059        stpe = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(2);
060        scheduledFuture = stpe.scheduleAtFixedRate(this::updateBlockHeight, initialDelay, period, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
061
062        groupStartedFuture.thenRunAsync(RxPeerGroup::peerGroupStartedListener, stpe);
063
064        peerGroup.addConnectedEventListener(this::onPeerConnected);
065        peerGroup.addDisconnectedEventListener(this::onPeerDisconnected);
066        peerGroup.addOnTransactionBroadcastListener(this::onTransaction);
067    }
068
069    @Override
070    public void close() {
071        if (stpe != null) {
072            if (scheduledFuture != null) {
073                final ScheduledFuture<?> handle = scheduledFuture;
074                Runnable task = () -> handle.cancel(true);
075                stpe.schedule(task, 0, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
076            }
077            stpe.shutdown();
078        }
079        if (peerGroup != null && peerGroup.isRunning()) {
080            peerGroup.stopAsync();
081        }
082    }
083
084    @Override
085    public Publisher<Transaction> transactionPublisher() {
086        return transactionProcessor;
087    }
088
089    @Override
090    public Publisher<Sha256Hash> transactionHashPublisher() {
091        return transactionProcessor.map(Transaction::getTxId);
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * TBD: Can {@link BlocksDownloadedEventListener} be used here?
096     */
097    @Override
098    public Publisher<Block> blockPublisher() {
099        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented");
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * TBD: Can {@link BlocksDownloadedEventListener} be used here?
104     */
105    @Override
106    public Publisher<Sha256Hash> blockHashPublisher() {
107        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented");
108    }
109
110    @Override
111    public Publisher<Integer> blockHeightPublisher() {
112        return blockHeightProcessor;
113    }
114
115    @Override
116    public Publisher<ChainTip> chainTipPublisher() {
117        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented");
118    }
119
120    private static void peerGroupStartedListener() {
121        log.info("PeerGroup started listener called");
122    }
123
124    private void updateBlockHeight() {
125        int newHeight = getBlockHeight();
126        if (newHeight != lastHeight) {
127            lastHeight = newHeight;
128            blockHeightProcessor.onNext(newHeight);
129        }
130    }
131
132    private int getBlockHeight() {
133        return peerGroup.getMostCommonChainHeight();
134    }
135
136    private void onTransaction(Peer peer, Transaction tx) {
137        log.info("PeerWatcher: Got transaction: {}", tx.getTxId());
138        transactionProcessor.onNext(tx);
139    }
140
141    private void onPeerConnected(Peer peer, int peerCount) {
142        log.info("PeerWatcher: Peer Connected: {}, count: {}", peer.getAddress(), peerCount);
143    }
144
145    private void onPeerDisconnected(Peer peer, int peerCount) {
146        log.info("PeerWatcher: Peer Disconnected, count: {}", peerCount);
147    }
148}
